name: Camping Jaz Budva
description:
Big terrain that is used at parking for beach during the day.
Old campgrand with a lot of space under big trees, right to the beach, with beach shower (free) , clean WC(50 cts) and possibility for washing machin (5euros) under the "wild beauty", little market and restaurant there, not wiew on the beach, but for us nice place to stay for a few days

name: Ivan Do camping
description: Nice campground right at the trailheads to Durmitor hiking paths. New showers, wifi, kitchen with a stove.

name: Mimoza Camping
description:
Nice campsite with plenty of shade. Views of the water/bay. On site restaurant with good food and ok wifi. 10 euro a night for 1 person and tent.
Access to pier for swimming is just over the road. If this place is full there are another campsite next door.

24.06.2018
Price for one night for two persons, two motorcycles and one small tent - 15€

name: Safari Beach Camping
description: cant miss the signs to this place. nice spot right on the beach with tall pines for shade

name: Tropicana Camping
description: Next door to safari beach but less crowded and a little cheaper. Basic facilities but clean. Seems to be run by old german guy ADAC. Pleasant spot

name: Beachside Parking
description: It’s a smaller parking spot, small beach and quite wide concrete space below the parking area. It is located below the main road which shelters the spot from noise or being seen. The beach is really tiny and at the end of Risen up the hill so not many people go there. Last people were here around midnight and since then nothing, around 6am someone went fishing on a motor boat and around 8am some tourists showed up. Overall pretty private and peaceful. No smells, generally clean. Great thing is it’s located below a big mountain so in the morning there is no sun until about 8-9 am, total luxury. After that there is no sharing except for the beach. Water is super nice! And oh boy, the views are great.

name: Camp Most
description: Camp most is a lovely little camp right under the big bridge! Price is ok, the way down is kind of steep! The offer rafting and zip lining

name: Izvor Camp / Hostel
description: The car camp is behind the Igvor Hostel like 5km away from Podgorica. It's the only camp around this area! Wifi at the reception, electricity at place! The canyon is right in front! Toilets and Shower underneath the parking bays, payed 5€/person & 5€/camper van

name: Camp Eco Oaza
description: Big grassy campsite with big trees in the Tara gorge. Clean toilets and showers, restaurant. Covered picknick tables with electricity available. Access to Tara river and tiny beach via steep 400m footpath. Hardly any noise from the road. English spoken. Very nice owners. We paid 13 Euro for car + 2 p. without electricity. Well recommended.

name: Kamp Grab
description: Rafting camp, but very suitable for camping. Huge grassy terrain for tents or campers, lots of space. Little beach on the river. Very well kept. Camping 10Euro for two persons. Beautiful surroundings. Activities also include hiking, photo safaris, biking and canoeing. Set dinner is 5,60 Euro. Very good food. Note: to acces the road to Grab from Montenegro, drive past the Montenegro side of the border stating that you want to go to Grab. Before the river turn right, the customs officer will open the gate for you.

name: Autocamp Naluka
description: Small grassy campsite with shade. Clean toilets, showers. Small sites, in season rather packed. Noise from the road and beachbar. Acces to beach nearby. We paid 18 Euros for two people and car..

name: Camp Lakeviews
description: 16 euro for two persons and a van per night. If needing electrical hookup there are three plugs in the grass area. Large grass area with some shade trees and picnic tables. Place to do dishes and laundry. Two squat toilets. Hot water shower. The toilets do have a urine smell to them though are clean. There are rooms as well. Laundry, washing machine available for 5 euro per load. No dryer. The owners are really nice. The onsite restaurant has excellent food. And wifi was good speed; upload photos to Internet fairly easily and skype call no problem.

name: Kotor
description: We slept  next to a  Turkish couple.                                                           From here, just In a few minutes  you  arrive to the walls of Kotor, shaken by an earthquake in 1979 and declared a World Heritage site later on. In one of the entries there is a tourist office where you can get some information and a  city map. There are old buildings and a great  labyrinth of cobblestone alleyways and streets where it is advisable to get lost.

name: Ulcinj, Montenegro
description: Right on the same beach, and although there are several car parking with shade on the way to here, we prefer the intimacy of this spot. Returning to the main road R-17 there are  several shops to buy what  essential goods if you want to remain here for several days.

name: Lonely Promontory
description:
A beautiful place close to the ocean. You stay on gravel, almost level having plenty of space with a wonderful view. Most of the streets around are gravel roads (don't worry if you drive through a gravel pit, that's normal), but the last few hundred meters are paved because it's quite steep. At the end there's a turning bay and underneath the pitch. 
Maybe there are some locals here in main season, but we were alone in October.

name: On the edge
description:
Follow down a rugh gravel road until you see the framing of a round tower. It seems like the working on it stopped some time ago. Underneath of it there is a flat surface made out of the buildings waste material and concrete. Perfect camping place even for bigger vehicles. You get more than 180° view and silence. 
If you follow down the road further 1km you find a nice beach, but no good place to park there. 
If you want to pitch a tent, do it in the penthouse of the tower (picture)!

name: Lost Camp Buljarica
description:
nice campground at the beach. The gate is open. No shade. 

EDIT: Right now (beginning of September) this is a official campground and not looking nice.

name: Mlinski Potok
description:
Friendly owners willing to help with trail info. Terraced pitches.
Shower block/kitchen .Nice. Wifi & average. free. Lovely views.potable water everywhere.
Perfect for both campervans and tents.

name: Lovcen Pocket
description: A small, flat area up a gravel road and next to a small pocket filled with trees and washed out rock formations where you can do some very easy evening climbing

name: Eko Selo Durmitor
description: Small huts next to the restaurant. Shared bathroom. It was 5 euro per pax. You can park your motorcycle in front of your hut.

name: Biogradska National Park
description: Beautiful lake, lots of hiking trail leading to viewpoints. These trails are accessible by off road bikes. Camper vans can park here for a fee. Please check the photos for the charges. Additional 1.5 euro per person per night not mentioned in the list. Was planning to camp here but was put off by a large group making lots of noise.

name: Viewpoint overlooking canyon
description: Look out for Bench. Stunning view point overlooking the canyon.

name: Biogradska National Park
description:
Beautiful lake, lots of hiking trail leading to viewpoints. These trails are accessible by off road bikes. Camper vans can park here for a fee. Please check the photos for the charges. Additional 1.5 euro per person per night not mentioned in the list. Was planning to camp here but was put off by a large group making lots of noise.

Entry ticket €3 per pax
Camping Big Tent €5
Camping Small Tent €3
Camp Trailer €10

name: Camping ecofarm OK Koral
description:
A small oasis close to the lake Skader.  The ecofarm is run by a lovely family who are very knowledgeble about the nature and surroundings. The home cooked food is stunning.. they can also organise cano or kayak trips.
Camping is on a grassy field before the farm, or you can rent a tent onsite.
Access is via a small asphalt road and then left trough the riverbed and via a field. Not suitable for caravans or large campers. 
Highly recommended !
Price level to high 9 € pp

name: Saki Apartmani
description: Sedat is the owner and he is a rider, too. 2 pp for private room with bathroom is 29 euro begininf of september. Very clean, good wifi. Safe parking for moto.

name: Border Crossing
description: Fast border crossing from Montenegro to Albania.

name: Lots of wild camping space by lake
description:
A large area with short grass and trees, right next to a dam which you can walk up to get to the lake. There is a small beach at the end. A little exposed if it's windy but otherwise very nice. There is a hand painted sign down one end saying 'autocamp' and 'parking €2' but we didn't see anyone collecting money and just drove down the other end anyway

User reported on 29 April 2019: It is very dirty, trash everywhere. Wild/ stray dogs that run around.

name: The silent lake
description:
Free camping at a lake near the Durmitor national park.
We had a very peaceful evening, night and morning here. There is just one little road near by, which is not really frequented. You can park at every side of the lake.
Attention:
Use the approach at the little house, the other one is very precipitous!

name: once a parking place
description: This used to be the parking of the motel but that closed years ago!!  Park behind the stone ruins on the flat asphalt. It is possible to go further down the dirt track but its a nice hike too. Perfect to go in the mountains.

name: autocamp nule
description: small camp just on the sea. not very flat. on green. some trees for shadow. wc. cold shower. 12€ for 2+motorhome. for electricity you pay on top. nice view

name: Kapetanovo Jezero
description: Beautiful mountain lake. At about 1700m. On a meadow right next to the lake. Sadly there was some littering by others.

name: Restoran Gnijezdo
description: Restaurant with large grassfield. we ask for a place, and he said ; be my guest. no cost.

name: Camping Zlokovic
description: Small campsite between Main Road an beach. a little noise because of the road. friendly owner and clean toilets and showers. may be full in main season. nice restaurant directly at the seaside.

name: Camping Oliva
description: Small Campground directly at the beach. about 30 campers will fit between many olive trees. Grassy ground and very clean showers and toilets. A lot of shops and restaurants just around in the small village. Price was 17 euro for Camper and two people including electricity.

name: Hotel Lovac
description: A nice and friendly hotel in the Durmitor National Park. A 2 room apartment with a bathroom and a kitchen costs 10€ / person / night.

name: Viewpoint over Pivkalake
description:
Viewpoint hidden behind a big rock with small shelter, rocky ground. Possible for a vehicle the size of a Landcriuser, Defender or VW van to find a even place, not suitable for mobilehomes, trailers
Although it is next to the road, it was quiet, no Traffic during the night
Great view of the lake!

name: Hotel Ellena
description:
Cheap hotel. New rooms and ample parking just before/over the Croatian border. 

€32 per night on Booking.com

name: Lovcen Meadow at Park Boundary
description: 4x4 only to go on gravel track and then into a meadow. Beautiful overlook nearby. You can see the Bay and the Adriatic. This spot is on the edge of the park, so there is a bit of noise from the houses below.

name: Tara Gorge
description: Montenegro does not allow wild camping … but occasionally it becomes almost inevitable. This spot offers the possibility to stay if necessary. It’s a good sized gravel parking set back a bit from the road, which is dead a night.

name: Pine Forest at Arza beach
description: Close to beautiful Arza beach, some neat camping places in a small pine forest.

name: Municipality Campsite
description: Large flat grassy field with plenty of space. Not much shade. New showers and toilets which are being finalized but can already be used and are good. Price is € 15 per vehicle/tent, regardless of the number of persons.

name: ferry port
description:
ferrys to cross the river.
easy and fast. 
we paied 9euro for a campervan and 2 Person.

name: Road to the cave
description: There’s a piece of gravel with some even spots next to a waterfall (you can’t see, just hear). You get there if you turn of the main road onto a narrow gravel track. Coming from the Tarabridge it’s 50m before the tunnel on your left. Going to the Tarabridge it’s 50m after the tunnel on your right.  Great view on the mountains surrounding you and instead of the traffic you hear the water falling.

name: Autokamp Njive
description: Nice campground with awesome view on the lake. Swimming pool, toilet, shower. 10€/pppn. Ok for big rigs but access road is narrow.

name: Camp Agape
description: Eco camp, great spot! Peacefull, friendly place with chickens and dogs. Situated on the mountain. The road to the campsite is off road, the last 100m is pretty heavy. Really friendly people looking after the place! You can have dinner and breakfast. €16 for camp, €6,50 pp for dinner, €3,50 pp for breakfast

name: Camping Maslina
description: Open all year. Standard amenities, fast wifi. We paid 12€ for 3 in a campervan with electric (off season). Very friendly staff speaks perfect English. Easy walk to beach.

name: Close to the Beach
description: Quiet overnight spot close to the beach. There are showers on the beach with a water tap. Restaurants close by. Stayed here a couple of nights in March, no problem at all.

name: In the heart of Budva
description: This place is at the beach and has showers at the beach also close to Restaurants and only a short walk to the old town centre. We stayed here for a nights without any problems, really like the old town centre a lot of history. Be careful we almost missed the entry to the parking lot.

name: Quiet overnight spot next to a park
description: Quiet overnight spot next to a park. Parking is free, only a short walk to the center of town and the Monastery.

name: Great views and quiet
description: This is a great spot, it is quiet and has great views over the ocean and the city. It is a big parking area we payed $7.50 for 2 nights large motorhome with 2 people. If you lucky the guy is not here to collect but it is worth the price. The town centre is only a short walk also there are showers on the beach and plenty of restaurants.

name: Peter‘s pie & coffee - vegetarian vegan
description:
Great little vegetarian/vegan café/resto at the promenade. 
They have fresh and healthy food and juices. We had the best coffee in a while there. Prices are also reasonable.

name: Iveco Kov-Car
description: Super friendly Iveco shop that helped me right away when I had a major transmission breakdown.

name: Lipci. Prehistorical rock painting.
description: From the main road, follow the sign Lipci, turn into single lane asphalt road going up between the houses. (about 200 metres before roundabout when you come in from Kotor). There is a small gravel parking on the end of the road. Walk up (keep the last House on your left side), you will find a rocky path going up. There is a sign on you right hand side with a white arrow (between the bushes, hard to spot). Follow path upward (5 minutes). You will see a small cave on the right hand side, follow path. There is a small fence with a panel explaining what you see. Stand in front of the panel and look up. The paintings are on the brown rock. Take a good look as they might be hard to spot. Remember, these paintings are from 8 century BC.

name: Camp Oaza Lipa
description: Very nice natural site, friendly owner, very quiet and a beautiful view over the valley. Bit basic but that’s how we like it. There is a kiosk with terrace for coffee, drinks etc. I have read one can have breakfast here but didn’t try.

name: Camp Begovic
description: Beatiful site, next to the sea. More than enough shadow under the olive trees. Pretty remote so bring supplies. Check their website for details and opening hours. Right now (2019-05-05) the site is closed but the friendly owner allowed us to stay anyway.

name: Karuc Apartments
description:
Nice and quiet place in the river.
35€ double room with private bathroom and terrace with river views.
Very friendly people.
They can cook for you local fish. 
Limited Internet access. 
Hard to arrive and find.

name: Hostel / Camp Janketica
description:
One of the best spots I have ever been, in the middle of a paradise in the mountains. The place is inside the National Park.

Run by a really nice family and Diana, the host, is the most kind and enchanting girl in of all Montenegro. 
You can Camp, or stay in one of those small houses (only a double bed inside) breakfast included and in the restaurant you can enjoy delicious meals!!! 

If it is raining, the last 10 kilometers of the road could be complicated if you haven’t a 4x4 and the road is narrow for big rigs, but an MB Vito van has no problems arriving. Great for motorcycles!!!

In the night, if the sky is clear, you can enjoy an amazing starry night.

name: Autokamp Kascelan
description: a small campsite but with nice places in the back of te campsite,up the hill. friendly owners. We paid 35€ with 3 cars 3 tents and 1 rooftent and a dog, no electricity, but we helped the owners to unload a truck full of hay, so the price was maybe a bit cheaper.

name: In the Montenegro Mountain
description:
Flat quiet area in the mountain. Easy access with two or four wheels drive. Lot of potential spot here with some rocks. But it was good to pitch our tents.
4G.

name: camp Budva
description: established campground along the (dry) river. many places for tent. toilets and sh. owners just OK, the spots are clean and shady. we paid 13 eur for 2 person & 1 tent. wifi works fine.

name: Bartula - My Olive Garden Camp
description: Beautiful camping on the side of the hill. Views on the mountains behind Bar. Super-clean bathrooms, excellent wifi, a lot of shade. Not for caravans and campers, since the spots are on narrow olive-trees terraces. Electricity available (scattered spots in the camping). There is a river pool at 5-min trekking. People are friendly. Without any doubt one of the nicest camping we've been.

name: On a field
description:
On a field, with the agreement of the owner, who is Serbian.

Dans un près avec l'accord du proprio qui est Serbe.

name: Riverside camping
description:
pretty campsite very expensive 10 only 1 toilet no dishware no water directly pump in the river avoided beautifull expensive camping only if you dont find other place

joli camping très cher 10 seulement 1 toilette pas de bac a vaisselle pas d'eau directement pompe dans la rivière a evite beautifull expensive  camping only if you dont find other place

name: Kamp Sarban
description: Designated campsite right below the trailhead of the hike to Mt Prutas. There is a sign. Nice grassy field with a few benches, nothing else. Great surroundings and peaceful. Ranger might come to collect the NP entrance fee in the morning (around 9am), 5e park ticket plus 3e a night. There is a little source with drinking water, but not marked, it's indicated on most gps maps.

name: Campsite near Hotel restaurant Jezero, lake Piva, Pluzine
description:
We camped at the concrete next to the lake. A lookout / ‘beach’ has been created here, nice children playground, several benches and 2 cold showers at the premises. 

The hotel restaurant, at 50 meters, also has a terrace and garden seats. Good quality food for very reasonable prices. Beer 🍺 half a liter 1,40€. Nice owner, Milena Jezero. Local people also visit the place. 2p room 20€ excl breakfast. WiFi at the restaurant and some 30 meters around. Toilet also at the restaurant. 

Ideal place to relax and have a
swim after long drive through the mountains with views at this lake. Beautiful and still quiet in high seasons. Locals also visit the place of course. No trash around!

name: Quarry above Podgorica
description:
This is a spot in a small quarry, up a narrow but paved road. Great views over Podgorica, very quiet, free, didn't get bothered. Only two cars drove past. Terrain is very slightly inclined.
There was some loud music coming from the next house (200m away), but it stopped later in the evening.
Thanks to the mountains in your back you get some shade in the morning hours. Visible only for cars driving directly past, not from neighbouring houses.
Access road is steep, one lane only, and not for long or wide vehicles, not to mention trailers. Was easy in a 2wd VW van.
Some trash lying around, otherwise it would be a fantastic spot.
Tents: you can, if you're okay with stones on the floor.

name: Hostel Pupa
description: Sea front location. New and trendy design. Friendly staff. Towels are provided.

name: Autocamp Todorovic
description:
Small camping side directly at the sea. We stayed for one night and haven‘t had any problems. The owner is nice and lives in a house on the other side of the street.
Toilets and showers are self made but in a really good condition and clean. 
We also met nice People.

name: Camp Wesko
description:
It‘s a huge grass field directly at the river. The owner is one of the nicest and friendliest person I have ever met. Wesko (or Vesco) has two camping sites, on left and one right of the river. He stops by a couple of times during the day. He lives on the other site of the River. (you can see the white house with a red roof from the grass field) At his home he offers a lot of food (fish, fruits, vegetables, meet,...) and drinks. There also is the „real“ Camp Wesko with electricity and water. But you can choose freely between both places. 
The nature is really beautiful and the canyon is fantastic for hiking. (the route is marked with red signs) 
Sometimes a dog comes by, don‘t be scared of him, he belongs to the owner of the camp and is friendly to everyone. The dog even showed us the hiking trails and guarded our tent in the night. 
Drinking water is available from the river, you can drink it without thought. 
It’s 5€ no matter how many people, how big your car/tent is and how long you want to stay. We could even stay for free because students don’t pay anything at all.

name: Camp Podkraj
description:
Family run campsite in an idyllic location near the national park. €15 in August for two and a campervan. Can also rent already set up tents with lovely seating areas and hammocks if you need to. 

Owner can arrange an amazing boat trip (2hrs €50 for 2 people and they pick you up/drop off at the site). 

Home cooked breakfast and dinner available (€5 breakfast and drink. €7 dinner and wine). Beers, wine, cold drinks also available to buy for cheap and you can chill in the covered seating area. 

Part of the road is down a country track but my large camper made it here no bother. Google tries to take you the wrong way so just follow the signs the owner put out on the side of the road and ignore google trying to make you climb a mountain. 

Showers/bathrooms are seriously clean and in brand new condition. 

Mountain air at night is fresh and cool so it’s perfect to sleep listening to nature. It’s also away from the lake so no need to worry about excess mosquitos. 

I don’t think there is electricity as it’s more of a quiet nature site with lots of overlanders and tents.

name: Camping Miami
description: Nice clean campground for tents and campers directly on sand beach. Big beach with chairs and umbrellas to rent. Beach not so pretty since it is a long strand and no bay or rocks for the eye. Toilets and showers clean with hot water, toilet paper and soap at the sinks. Restaurant at the campground but did not try it. 18 euros for 2 people and camper.

name: Familiar campground
description: It’s a small familiar campground located in beautiful vineyards. The owners are very friendly. You have very very clean toilets and showers and a modern kitchen. The internet is really fast (if it’s not working check the battery of the thing and maybe charge it) and you have electricity at the site. I think there is also an apartment wich you can rent. Its 20€ for two people and car. They also have a new washing machine that you can use for 5€.

name: Remote Lake
description: It’s a remote lake near a tiny village. There are plenty spots around the river. You’ll need a 4x4 to get to the lake. You can get there from Podgorica via a beautiful trail trough the mountains. It’s 2 1/2 hours from Podgorica and you definitely need a 4x4. Its in the middle of the trail that goes in direction of the national park (https://de.wikiloc.com/routen-off-road/awesome-monte-negro-mountain-trail-remote-camp-spot-28744724). One of the most beautiful things I’ve seen in Montenegro.

name: CAMP RABRENOVIC
description: It’s a perfect campground located in beautiful mountains. It has clean toilets and showers, electricity and drinkable water. The WiFi is strong and fast at the whole campground. There a plenty of hiking options and not far away there is Tara river. The mother is cooking delicious food for you in the evening if you want. It’s 10€ per night including everything. You can also rent small huts but I don’t know the price.

name: Mountain top
description: It’s a small space on top of a mountain. I think you can make it by 2WD bus but not with big motorhomes. If it’s wet you’ll need a 4x4. There is a table and a bench beside a fireplace. You have a beautiful view above Tara river.

name: High hills
description: Plenty of places to pitch a tent. Camping with a van or rig might be harder but if you are on a motorcycle or bicycle you can leave the road easily and find a nice spot on level grass. It's very cold at night, well below zero in September. Very beautiful though. There are houses all around, but it's not hard to get out of sight.

name: Lovcen Autocamp
description: Very bad place, loud (streetnoise  and their own dog barks by night), toilets very dirty, only sometimes warm water for shower. Only go there, if you don't find something else. At least, very fast internet.

name: Camp Utjeha
description: Very nice place, privat enot a company. Clean ablution. Sites shady under olive trees. 50 m to the sea. 15 Eur 2 Pax Land Rover with roof tent.

name: Slano jezero
description: Nice place at the lake with views of the islands. Little close to the road, can hear some traffic, but no problem. We spent a rainy afternoon and a very quiet night here. There are some more spots around that corner. The road to it is narrow with lots of thorny bushes.

name: Auto Shop Tomicic
description: Well stocked small auto parts shop with very friendly English speaking owner. Not a mechanic but can sell parts and do minor changes (helped us change our lights) and can refer you to other mechanics in town.

name: Valley Near Sea
description: Nice flat area to camp under bigger pinetrees, not far to rocky cliff next to sea, fantastic sunsets, possibility for camp fire (not in dry season!). The access road is a gravel road, last part only for smaller 4wd cars. We loved this place big time, stayed here two days.

name: Submarine Bunker camp
description: Small spot at the end of a switch back. Could fit two vans of you were friends. Fine for bikes and tents. Fire pit and concrete structure to put chairs on and watch the sun set. Walk 75 m down to the sub base and explore. 4x4s could camp on the water at the sub base but there is a shelf drop off to negotiate at the bottom. awesome spot.

name: cheese and wine
description:
locals selling cheese and wine. 
great view and worth the stop.
friendly people and some feral cats. 
€9 for some cheese, a glass of wine and some bread. expensive!

name: Hostel Montevyzion
description:
Average hostel for the price. €8
it s winter is now so its a bit cold. kitchen and the common area are outside so kind of hard to use those at night or on rainy days. breakfast included but again all outside. 
kitchen is old, dirty and with a lack of tools and utensils.
bathrooms with shower adjacent so when you shower you kind of make a mess. 
parking for motorcycles and one car. It is a dead-end street so not so much traffic going on.

name: DEKAR Petrol Station
description: They fill up LPG gas bottles here. Apparently the only place in Montenegro and I stopped there by chance. Lucky me. Close to the beautiful Skadsr lake with lots of free camping spots, I'll let you figure that out by yourself. This was written during the Corona virus lock down.

name: Scepan Polje
description: Border Crossing between Monte Negro and Bosnia and Hercegovina

name: Border crossing
description:
Border crossing between Monte Negro and Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Beautiful road and scenery.

name: Corona Kite Beach
description:
Parking lot next to Aloha Beach and Corona Kite Beach (my guess is they'll change this name soon). Stayed here in May 2020 by the end of Corona lockdown in Montengro.

Nice and quiet spot, 100m from the beach, no shade. Be careful on the dirt road here, I got stuck and had to be pulled out by a truck.

name: Church with a view
description:
When entering Lustica peninsula, easily accesible by tarmac road. Nice and flat. Next to the church there are some benches with a nive view over the peninsula and the bay of Kotor.

For more secluded camping you can stay at the other side of the church as well. 

Stayed here for a night in May 2020. Church bells ring at 18h00 and at 8h00

name: Lake side
description: Next to Devil's lake but with better acces and enough space (on grass) for flat parking all along the north side of the lake. Drive a little over the dirt road and you can park at some distance of the main road. Nice little lake with some birds and views over the surrounding mountains.

name: Big pine forest park
description:
I'm surprise this hasn't been mapped yet. Massive fields with pine trees open grass and both tarmac and off road tracks. There must be a 50 hectares of camping ground here.

North side of the road from Podgorica to the Albanian border. 

If you come from Podgorica take a right after the deka fuel station (last one before going to Albania).

Quiet at night, cars with lovers around but loads of space to find a private spot. Birds, good sunset, anywhere between 100m and 700m from the main road. Open field, under the trees, whatever you like. Friendly people here in Montenegro, several locals told me it was fine for overnighting

name: 360 view
description: If you are thinking about ovelanding and wild camping this is the place you are looking for.  Amazing 360 view around you, totally no one here. Maybe some shepherd or wild horses passing by.  Peace and quiet. Perfect place to spot the milky way in the summer of course.  With Telenor prepaid 4g internet available.

name: Durmitor
description:
Beautiful place to spend the night or more to enjoy the view of the magnificent Durmitor mountains. Just next to the road, but nobody will bother you. Very few cars during a day passed. There is no internet coverage, just you and the nature. You can make a short or longer hikes in the area.  This place is on attitude 1800m so it can be windy and cold ,but still this is one of the few places that you will be totally alone.  Ones again perfect place for photographers. Milky way all around you,  from south to the north.  

We loved it

name: flat grounds next to mountain hut
description:
place with epic views on a mountain ridge. Next to a hut (abandoned when we were there).
Easy way up with 4x4, think it's doable with reasonable clearance regular car as well

CAUTION. the road is blocked, there is an old road next to it to drive past it, but it's for 4x4 only and quite serious..

name: restaurant and campsite at the lake
description: Small spot next to a restaurant. Views and place at the lake is great. Food is nice as well.

name: auto camp mlinski potok
description: Camp for hikers, climbers,overlanders, naturelovers. Enough place for big rigs, pets, Fee: Camper 4€ , person 3.5€ , pets free, electric 2€ and laundry machine 4€.

name: Magnus Moto
description: Motorcycle parts and gear. Not very big but good stock. Associated with a larger shop in  Podgorica. We needed a new battery for a 2006 F650GS and they had a lead acid and maintenance free battery in stock. We bought the lead acid for €44. Speaks English.

name: Camping Lake Views
description: Nice and Simply equiped but with beautyful view and a real good Kitchen in the Hotel Restaurant nearby

name: Dizdarica
description: Nice flat spot for camping. that is a starting point for paragliding so expect some people around on weekend. Fresh water spring near by. last 300m is tarmac road.

name: obalica
description: beautiful view on Boka bay. completely wild. concrete road lead to the village but its very steep. last 300m is gravel/mud road so it is not suitable for big vehicles. we went with VW t4 westfalia 2wd and it was tough. But when you come to the top you forget all the struggle.

name: Moj Lab
description: Lab providing PCR tests for travelers. Staff was very friendly and spoke great English. Cost is 49 euros and results are provided in the same day if you get the test done before noon. A negative PCR test was required to enter Bosnia & Herzegovina.

name: Fortress Gorazda kotor
description:
Beautiful spot and view of Kotor Baie. Some locals come here to enjoy the beautiful sunset. 
You can visit the Fort (for free, it's abandoned now). I love this place, beautiful view. Very clean

name: Moraca River
description:
Nice and flat place. Clear water of the Moraca River invites you to fish or swim.
Some cows appear occasionally. There are some picnic benches on the riverside to enjoy.

name: Trsteno Beach
description:
3 level areas. Large place to park during the day and we camped with a rooftop tent at night.
Looks abandoned and lot of garbage at the beach even it is is very nice.
Clear water and OK to pass the night.
Would look better if the people picked up the garbage. We collected 2 big garbage bags in 5 minutes. The public garbage collection bins were empty. Sad to see a nice place abandoned.We stayed one night.

name: Hostel Djukic Sasa
description:
Located in the Old Town
Talk to Joanna. She will help you.
Nice and well located, clean and cheap.
Paid € 15,00 for 2 persons for one night.
You can make your reservation by Booking, com

name: susicko jezero lake
description:
Picturesque spot by lake.
Stunning views ,campfire pit ,fresh water.
Couldn't ask for better really.
Plenty of day visitors.
Parking, quiet night when I was there.

name: Auto Camp Konak
description: Perfect place directly at the lake with cute Bungalows and probably also possible to place your campervan or tent. Very friendly owner and reasonable prices with a great breakfast included. Even if hidden and right now a bit cumbersome to reach because of road works, it is definitely the best place to find in this town.

name: VRBAC -  Refreshing spot with beautiful view.
description:
It is a great place near by Kotor and Tivat, especially if you want to get out of the heat. It is fresh, you can make a barbecue with a good view of Kotor Bye. There are many trees and lots of place for more campers.

Here is a shepherd  who keeps goats and Vietnamese pigs, he is very friendly and it's possible to buy local eco cheese, milk or meat from him when he has.

The place is free, no electricity but there is rain water if you needed for washing. Nice hiking trail is passesing by to the top of the hill with a beautiful view. 

There are many interesting remains of fortifications from the Austro-Hungarian monarchy nearby.

name: Pine Forest
description:
Nice spot next some beaches, well covered by pines and.. trash. The entrance is 150m south, next to the curve.
You can enter easily even with a van.

Ciao

name: Belvedere
description:
Tasty restaurant with a beautiful view on the valley. Had a big dinner for 2 people, 20€. Great service.

We parked our motorhome by the restaurant (grassy parking in the back) and stayed for the night. Quiet and fresh.

name: Drinking water station! Free
description: Free drinking water near the free parking lot! Fill up here as much as you want.

name: Murici Campsite
description:
Small but cosy campsites. Clean facilities, WiFi, electricity and direct beach access.
5€ per Person, 5€ small car/van, 10€ big rig 
Wild Camping actually possible next to it. Some people just pitch their tent on the beach.

name: Auto Servís Magic
description:
Near Kotor.

We changed 2 of wheels here. Not expensive.

I already had 2 spare wheels but in diferent rims (original is aluminium and spare is iron)

Came here by Pachamama eco farm recommendation.

WhatsApp:
+382 69 649 726

name: Wild place
description: Wild place Near Dumitor National Park. Very quite

name: Auto Servis Markovic
description: Big Garage for cars. But changed my motorbike chain and the wheel bearings plus fixed some plastic parts (50 Euro including Swing arm removal as I had an endless chain). Well equipped.

name: Mijakovici camp
description:
Small campsite which also has 3 bungalows.
Owner very friendly. Possibility of breakfast, lunch, coffee.
Wc and showers are very clean.
Nice place!. Wifi available.

name: River Restaurant
description:
Two nice restaurants at the river here. Huge carp (rather for two) is 5 Euro.  Lake Outlet with very warm water to swim, camping possible in the back. Wild horses by the lake shore close by. 

Just before the bridge 2 km East of here (signs Ethno Village) take the road then gravel between the two rows of house (the center one).

name: Acimic Moto
description: Auto and moto service, English-speaking owner. Motorcycle equipment and parts store.

name: Magnus moto
description: Motorcycle service and parts. English speaking staff.

name: Border Crossing Cijevna
description: New (2021) border crossing Albania-Montenegro

name: Kuca Rajo Radovic Camp
description: Simple, but nice campsite a few meters from the river. It is a small family farm. Very friendly owners.

name: Pelikan hotel
description:
Free parking for camper car including water, electricity, shower, wifi and breakfast free.
Contact: +38269038928 available WhatsApp

name: Archeological Cave Crvena Stijena
description:
Keep on the upper road. Downwards will end at the lake. Archeologists life in the village 5 minutes before. 
Not much to see without archeologist guiding you except of the outer cave. 
Nice view from the parking place at the end of the paved road and possible to stay. Don’t drive the last 400m to the cave, no space to turn around and uphill only 4wd with diff locks!

name: Huge grass plain
description:
Flat grassy area shielded from the city's street lights and from views. Enough space for an arbitrary amount of vehicles or tents. Easily acessible from the main road by taking the eastern access at the northern tip of the bridge.
Some ambient, distant traffic noise is noticable but not really disturbing. The river is accessible by foot through a steep descend but not well-suited for bathing here. For that, better use the public bathing place at the southern tip of bridge down by the restaurant.

name: Picnic area near Pirlitor fortress
description: Nice grassy kind of flat spot, very clean, with fire pit and a bench. Easily accesible by a 4x4, but I don't think big rigs will fit the path to the place. Bring water with you. Nice crags at a five minute walk, if you're into rock climbing.

name: AutoCamp Zelenika
description:
Nice campsite in forest-like area, far enough away from the street to not get annoyed by it. Basic showers and toilet, roofed terrace with 2 fridges, tables, dish washing options.

Few spots for big cars but enough for smaller cars and tents.

Beach access across the street, down a few stairs to stone beach. Little bar accross the street as well, supermarket about 400m.

Payed 20€ for 4 people and 2 tents

name: Big place by the lake
description:
Beautiful spot full of grass near the lake!

Access to this big place is possible to all vehicles.
You'll find space for a lot of vehicles, some flats, some not.
There are some local fishermens and a lot of dogs. They're really friendly but do not leave your shoes out of your car/tent or you'll go for a 10min run after the dogs hahaha

name: Close to the Beach II
description: Parking close to the beach. Gates open in winter. Gravel area is much larger and much easier to find and to enter, compared to the "Close to the Beach" spot  400 metres away.

name: Parking near Kotor
description: Free parking near Kotor. Just 500 m walk. Direct at the water, gravel ground. In the night quiet. We stayed there for one night.

name: Zeta Trzni Centre - SEWING service
description: Inside this little shopping centre,  1st floor, is a lady doing sewing services. Fixed my motocycle jeans. Speaks only serbian (google translator)

name: Adriatic see laundry
description: Very nice laundry service, this is a full service laundry. We paid €20,- for 2 washes including drying. I think this is the only laundry service in Tivat.

name: Kotor Bay View
description: Direct near the road there is a big flat area with a beatifull view over the bay. Low traffic, very quiet.

name: car camp razvrsje
description: nice campplace . very quiert. Mika will help you whit a lot of things. Also possible for bigger groups. Every guest get Free Coffee and home made snaps. Camp is 2.5 km from the Town.

name: Riverside
description: Short road off the main highway that dead ends at the river. Turnaround may be be difficult depending on how big your vehicle is. Do-able with a tent, but not ideal. We cleared a bit of the rocky beach for our tent. A bit of garbage, a bit of noise from the highway, but overall a decent little spot on the river.

name: Tuzović Bungalows
description: Great little cabins tucked into the woods. The area was very busy when we arrived, parking lots full and hikers everywhere. Every bungalow in the area was exposed to the chaos, except this one. A few steps back into the trees and you’re alone. Very kind host, and nice two-story bungalow with bathroom for 35€ per night. There are a couple bigger ones with a small kitchenette for €40 as well. The prices in the area are all generally the same, ranging from €30-40/night, some of the others included breakfast in the price.

name: Kamp Scepanovic
description:
Peaceful and natural camping jewel hidden from the main road surrounded by nature. Access via main road up a steep driveway (watch for sign Kamp Scepanovic as not to turn to busy adjacent Camp Rab). 

Also No big RVs. New, simple and clean facilities. Warm water. Rustik and traditional Ambience with two great fire patios. Kitchen for cooking and cleaning. Traditional food upon request or lucky surprise breakfast. Washing machine available!

10€ w/o electricity (+3€)

name: Camp Lipovo
description: Very friendly campground for overlanders and pets. Nice area and perfect food in the smolest Kitchen of Montenegro

name: Kamp Lipovo
description: Very tranquil small campground with lodges for rent as well, run by a Dutch couple. Would suit campers and tents. By a small river, flat areas for camping and campers. Two toilets and showers plus washing machine - all clean and well kept. They serve a very nice local breakfast and dinner (€10). €10 for 1 car/tent/person. Google Maps is slightly wrong, keep going and then there will be a sign pointing left which takes you down an easy gravel road.

name: Bird sanctuary
description: Very nice and private little campground with a few fire spots, up a old unused road that goes from dirt to asphalt. Tires can be moved to get car in, flat ground for tents. A lot of birds chirping here day and night, a lot of condensation also.

name: Zaborje motel and camping
description: Great flat camping,€10 for motorcycle, tent and one person. Showers a bit extra, inside motel. restaurant has great food, english owner and really friendly and helpful english speaking staff that know the local area and advise best places to go.

name: Zaborje
description: Motel with 7 rooms on E761, offering a restaurant and camping.

name: Camp Sunny Hills
description: This is a small family run campsite.Place for a rest and relaxation surrounded by nature and a beautiful view of the mountains. There is a toilet , shower with hot water, electricity , kitchen , amazing terrace , washing mashine , barbecue , childrens playground and farm with a animals. The camp is open all year . Parking cost 10 euro.You can order food that is delicious and homemade. All on a plate directly from the farm. About 1km from the camp there is a beautiful river where you can swim. The host a kind and hospitable!

name: Stari Bar free water
description: You can fill up your bottles for free here without entering the paid historical site, it’s located on the right side below the ticket office. The ticket guy confirmed it was drinkable and we had no issues.

name: Place for a tent
description: Fantastic spot for a tent or wildcamping in general, only accessible by walking - a small irregular path from the asphalt road will lead you there. We arrived before 10pm and nobody walked anywhere near by (except the road but they could not see us from there as it’s much lower) until around 10am. It’s in a pretty dense pine forest so we had a comfy temperature the whole time. Only bad thing is that Petrovac musicians are super loud until midnight and shortly after the cicadas start being noisy. Apart from that great private place to sleep for free.

name: Guesthouse Kapija Kanjona
description: Several pitches in a meadow next to this establishment where you can drink and eat excellent food. The managers of the place are very friendly and offer camping for free. A path leads to the Tara river, about 10-15 min walk down to the beautiful river.

name: Etno selon Izlazak
description:
Excellent restaurant, with an Amazing view. 
I taste the popeci it was great. 
The local wine Vladika

name: Mausoleum of Njegoš
description: The place is next to the intersection Mausoleum/Cetinje, approx. 1 kilometer below the mausoleum.  The access to the place itself is about 200 meters across the meadow.  The capacity of the area is large, approximately 10 motorhomes.  You can also set up classic tents on the ground. Restaurant is at mausoleum, approx. 1 km from this place.

name: Camp frutak
description:
Nice campsite by river. Hot shower, Wi-Fi, Tents , big rigs. Easy access off main road and quiet in the evening.
Food and cold drinks available. Very friendly owner.
Area is flat. Kayak available for river which is crystal clear.
This is a new campsite and it is spotless.
20 euros per camper not per person.
Motorbike and tent is 10 euros.
Also available are 2 Glamping tents which sleep 3 for 50 euros.

name: Water Fountain
description:
Water Fountain beside the road.
Locals fill up their water bottles here as well.

name: Plavnica Camping
description:
Very nice place! Owners are very friendly and helpful. They offer excellent food (fish - carp - with potatoes and salad). They also offer boat tours, which we can really recommend. A lot of birds can be watched.
Cleanliness is very good.

name: Camping in a field
description: Coming from the very end of the parking lot of the restaurant, there's a small little road that goes down to a very pretty field. On the field you can pitch a tent or park without much hassle. There was a farmer that came around sunset to collect his cows and paid absolutely zero attention to me. The bendy road down is narrow and quite sharp so not ideal for bigger rigs, though a van probably will fit. My regular car made it no issue but some good ground clearance is recommended.

name: Georgijevic Rooms
description: Probably the cheapest option in town E25 for double room. Great parking for motorcycles. Reasonably close to beach and restaurants etc but the steep walk back up the hill will test your fitness. Located up a driveway from the small dead end alley. Recommended.

name: Rooms Banicevic
description: Very friendly family owned guesthouse with good parking for motorcycles. Short walk to waterfront, restaurants, groceries etc. Steep hill will test your fitness though. E35 per night peak season. Cheapest around.

name: Metaljka
description: Very scenic country road with extremely quiet border crossing. No Greencard available but was not asked for entering Bosnia Herzegovina. Very fast and easy crossing

name: next to the River
description: Nice spot, no people coming by for several days. The water is clear and fresh, but the river is not deep. 4g

name: EKO gas station
description: You can get here fresh drinking water next to the building. Adapter and hose are available as well.

name: Plav wildcamp
description: A secluded wild camping site by the river and the lake. There are small gardens in the area, but this is not private land. A dirt road leads to the place.

name: JUNCAJ
description: Last fuel station in Montenegro to fill up cheap petrol, Albania is more expensive and lower quality (they say), beware there is nothing at the border to fill up as i expected !!

name: Begov Camping
description:
Simple, yet nice and calm camping besides the lake. I was actually the only one... unimaginable in many other campings in high season. I paid €10 for a night (I'm cycling so only had tent). Owners are very friendly, they gave me figs, homemade yoghurt and pastries 

The shower is fine, but it's right next to the toilet so everything gets wet but nothing you can do about that. There's a seating area where you can charge your phone underneath the two cabins that they also rent. Don't know the price of that.

name: Short Hike to Curevac
description: You can walk up to Curevac Mountain. Very scenic view and short (20min) hiking trail. There is also a ticket station where you can buy tickets for the national park (3€ p.P./ Day)

name: Auto camp Pisce
description: If you do not like a wildcamp this place is great. Great views over the highlands

name: Tyre Repair (and Car Repair)
description:
Mainly a tire repair shop, but the owner worked on a big truck when we have been there. Speaks some English and didn’t charged us.
Best service in all shops I needed to use, if you want you get a beer while waiting

name: Abandoned Building
description: just follow the small road till the end and turn right. nice place with plenty of small "garden" areas to pitch a tent. building seems quite unstable so I wouldn't recommend entering it. perfect for cyclists. cars couldn't enter and this place is extremely quiet.

name: water fountain
description: Water fountain that apears to be potable water.

name: Korita
description: A flat concrete base big enough for 2-3 vehicles at an disused military base.

name: Kamp Kljajevića Luka
description: Proper campground with power, water, hot showers, wifi in or near restaurant.  Okay cell reception.  Welcome came with a shot of their homemade schnapps!  Very friendly.

name: Hotel Pyramid
description: A great place to visit Podgorica. Parking by hotel Piramida. Safe, a bit loud in the evening (road), OK at night.  20 minutes walk to the center of Podgorica. Vehicle can't be taller than 3.2m or longer than 6.6ish.   Friendly owner. We paid 15 eu for 2 ppl in a motorhome. 4G signal.  Washroom inside by restaurant.  Ask about showers.  Wifi just reaches the sites but there is an outside seating area by reception.

name: Havana Beach
description: At this time of year the beach bar is closed but there is parking that is open and there are bathrooms as well as cold beach showers that are open but not cleaned. The only other amenity is garbage cans but they are pretty full. I don't expect they get emptied too often this time of year. There's a good 4G cell signal and not much else but you're right next to the beach which is 12 km long!  We were all alone except walkers on the beach.

name: Vuk Petrol, M1
description:
very long flexible Tube behind the Gas station to refill usable water; 
not sure if drinkable

name: Prokletije National Park
description: Lots of large meadows in the national park and right at the base of the trailhead. No facilities other than a well for water and a few covered picnic benches, but in season there are guesthouses and some restaurants. Amazing views.  We were here in November for 2 nights, met the local shepherd who gave us some hiking tips.

name: Prokletije National Park
description: Grassy pullover next to the road, space for one van. 4wd is needed to get here. Trailhead is about 500m up the road. We stopped here for two nights and had no problems.

name: Grazing fields
description: Unfenced grazing area for goats or sheep. I was riding all day and needed rest.

name: Medin Bar
description: large forested parking - paid €4 for one night - behind restaurant - right at beach - showers at beach - nice place

name: Ostrog Monastery
description: turn left before gate to large free parking, toilettes open all night, we asked employee at gate if staying over night was permitted and he gladly confirmed - stayed with roof tent on paved lot to the right

name: Apartmani Vulceljic
description:
Between the hotel and the guesthouse. 
There are 3 bedrooms with shared bathroom or a studio with private bathroom and kitchen around 20€/night. 
The family is lovely. 
Please note there are no shops nearby. Good wifi.
Inquire before but it seems that it is possible to have lunch, dinner or breakfast extra

name: free water tap.
description: i do not know if it's drinkable, but there is a free tap at the road.

name: National Park Prokletije
description:
Real big space in the National Park. Camping is allowed and you pay €3 per person at the entrance of the NP. 
The way to the national park is gravel, but bumby and you need to cross some water after rain.

name: SOS Manex Spedicija
description:
Insurance near the border on the Montenegro side. Up the stairs on the left side of the building, on the second floor. They sell for motorcycles, not sure about cars. 
€10 for two weeks on motorcycle.

name: Restaurant Most
description: Most defiantly good value and a convenient stop on the route to Kosovo! For 2 omelettes, 2 salads and 4 coffee we paid 15 Euro!

name: Njegovuđa
description: Wild camping on a meadow hidden and not visible from the road - absolutely quiet - probably some cows passing by

name: Crno Jezero Žabljak
description: Parking spot for up 7 campers next to a river on entrance of Black Lake - electricity available - quiet & maintained - 500m from Black Lake - 3€ for one night - toilets & restaurant towards Black Lake

name: Požar
description: Public water tap on way to Ostrog Monastery at the first parking lot on your right side - water pressure ok

name: Tanjga BBQ
description: Grill Restaurant with friendly staff where you can get huge burgers or platters for up to 3 persons and dry-aged steaks - platters are huge for a reasonable price if you want to avoid the overpriced restaurants inside Old Town of Kotor - you can eat in or outside or take away.

name: Abandoned ruins at Shkodra lake
description:
Wonderful place at the very end of the road, road and terrace of concrete, you can park a car here with the view to the lake. Swimming possible, couple of fisherman boats, don't know if they're working here.
Have seen one car - local family came to swim here.

name: Local Food Sale and Campsite near Lovćen National Park
description: This place is located next to the road between Lovćen National Park and Cetinje. Handwritten signs with the inscription "Kamp" indicate this. The meadow behind the house is a good place to pitch tents. There is also a car park for camper vans. During the night it was very quiet and there was no traffic on the road. The owner offers local products, drinks and food. I had dinner and breakfast there. The food was very good. There are no toilets, showers or running water. I got bottled drinking water from the owner. I could get water for showering from the cistern. The owner knew German quite well and was very helpful and friendly.

name: Kuca MaJo
description:
Very quiet and peaceful place on private ground with a sea view. Good accessibility for campervans or medium-sized motorhomes. Beach and restaurant nearby. 

Locally produced foods such as vegetables, honey, wine, rakija, cheese, ham, fish, etc. available. (depending on the season).

4G, free garden shower with warm water (solar).

Open all year - limited number of places available. It is best to call beforehand. One speaks English, German, Serbian and: Low German.

Fees: 
Campervan: 20 Euros per night
Electricity: 5 Euros
Fresh water: 3 Euros per 100 liter
Sanitation Dump Station: free
WIFI: free (not everywhere available)

name: Kuca MaJo
description:
Very quiet and peaceful place on private ground with a sea view. Good accessibility for campervans or medium-sized motorhomes. Beach and restaurant nearby. 

Locally produced foods such as vegetables, honey, wine, rakija, cheese, ham, fish, etc. available. (depending on the season).

4G, free garden shower with warm water (solar).

Open all year - limited number of places available. It is best to call beforehand. One speaks English, German, Serbian and: Low German.

Fees: 
Campervan: 20 Euros per night
Electricity: 5 Euros
Fresh water: 3 Euros per 100 liter
Sanitation Dump Station: free
WIFI: free (not everywhere available)

name: Hostel Q Podgorica
description: Hostel with all the comforts. Good Wi-Fi and good atmosphere. Bike and Motorbike can be parked in the garden (ask before!).

name: Tara Riverbed Wildcamp
description:
Pass the wood cutting company and take the gravel road to the right.
A lot of flat space at the river, 4x4 and ground clearance needed. Road is sandy and rocky. Full LTE reception, not much garbage.

name: Nice spot on a grass field
description: Turn right off the main road then right on the grass field.

name: little chapel
description: there's a small chapel, surrounded by just nature. there's a fire pitch, so I guess people have slept here before (or some exorcisms?)  nobody passing by, only one lady walking her dog, greeting me. very clean, nice shade and views

name: Hotel Grand
description:
Nice hotel directly on main road from/to Kosovo border.
Is actually winter/ski hotel so no AC in rooms but even in July is not hot in nights.
They ask 24€ for two people (is 12€ pp), but owner told us is ok 20 if we dinner in his restaurant, we do that and dinner was great and not expensive.

name: Kamengrad Cupica
description: a fantastic place , very family , you are really in the people 's garden . super friendly . The mom is happy to prepare some food that is really tasty. The young host is Marco

name: Purple Eye Estate - Camp & Winery
description:
Family estate - Camp & Winery on more than 50,000 m2, located in the central part of Montenegro, only 10 km from the capital Podgorica, in the charming village of Bandici, in a beautiful environment next to the Matica stream and of Purple Eye Lake.

The Campsite is easily accessible, only 5 minutes drive from the main road. Very good as a pit stop for RV and Caravan CAMPERS traveling from the north (mountains) to the south of the country (seaside). National parks in the highest mountain peaks, Ostrog Monastery, Lake Skadar as well as the beautiful Adriatic Sea, guests from here can reach in less than an hour drive.

Here we not only offer parking spaces, but unforgettable EXPERIENCE. Relax your mind and soul in a peaceful and magical place with a glass of wine or brandy (Tasting is INCLUDED in the price per night) and local cuisine. From our garden or nearby farms, we grow organic food and on demand prepare breakfast, lunch or dinner. Place is also favorable because it has COOL nights.

The Campsite has all the facilities you need. In addition to unlimited drinking water supply from springs, electricity, children's play area is also available, seating area, outdoor kitchen and cooking utensils, refrigerator, sanitary facilities (inside or outdoor showers) , etc.

Purple Eye Estate Camp & Winery is dedicated to people who want to enjoy beautiful view, pure ecological nature, wine, SILENCE/tranquility, comfort and fresh air. Exploring the beautiful parts of the village by renting a bike, canoe, horseback riding or hiking is also possible for those who like an active holiday. Many outdoor activities are also offered on site (table tennis, football, volleyball).

Whether you are a camper or a wine/brandy lover, a couple or a family with children, there is always something for everyone to satisfy their unique and individual desires and preferences.

The owner produces top quality wine and rakija from autochthonous Vranac and Kratošija grape varieties. Awakened by the chirping of birds, pick a fresh fig straight from the nearby fig tree and start your day filled with nature's energy. The orchards around the Villa offer over 5 truly delicious fruits that grow on our Estate.

In addition to offering you a place to rest and enjoy nature, our desire is to offer you top quality wines and local grappa (Rakija) selected from the best grapes in the vineyard, as well as to promote the ethnological TRADITION. Montenegrin culture and local organic food.

name: Camp Jatak
description: Pretty little camping and restaurant. Grass field were you can place your tent or caravan, shower and toilet, no possibility to discharge grey and black water

name: Large flat grass field with mountain views
description: A large flat field near the road, with grass being cut. There's a spring behind the house with the red roof. Locals came by and were very friendly. There was no traffic at all during the night and just a few cars during the evening. A 4G tower is in close proximity, so can be used for remote work.

name: Plains
description:
Nice place on some plains. It’s private, only occasionally I hear hikers on the road hundred meters or so from here (no cars drive there at all, the road has been superseded by a bigger road much further away). There is a construction site a few hundred meters away, they are building a cable car station and a park or something, so maybe the place won’t be as private in the future.

I only get 1-2 bars cell phone reception, but it still works fine to browse internet and stream video.

name: Viewpoint Buljarica
description:
Some kind of resting place with a gorgeous view. There are benches with tables and grills. I stayed from 17:00 Thursday to 10:00 Saturday and saw about 10 people. Mix between hikers, paragliders, and one couple coming by car to enjoy the view for a bit. No cars passing by to go somewhere else.

The ground is not suitable for tents, but it looks like you might be able to pitch a tent if you walk 100m along the hiking trail. No shade there though. Also, the ground has a lot of rocks here…

There is cell phone coverage.

name: Camp Ranč Aria
description:
Moderator note: Owner contribution. Check-in required to verify 

Nestled within our picturesque horse ranch, our campsite offers a serene escape from the bustle of daily life. Surrounded by animals and lush greenery, it provides a tranquil setting for outdoor enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. With spacious grounds you'll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the beauty of the great outdoors while experiencing the charm of ranch life. Whether you're seeking a peaceful retreat or an adventurous getaway, our campsite at the horse ranch promises an unforgettable experience in the heart of nature.

name: Camp Vrbnica
description: First-come, first-served campground located at the confluence of the Vrbnica river and Piva Lake - 9 km from town of Pluzine towards the village of Stabna. At the riverside. Very quiet and cozy place. Family owned. Great for tents and campervans! (May-September)

name: Camp Ranč Aria
description: Stunning horse ranch,good place to stop by on your way to explore Montenegro,specially if you like animals.There are horses, dogs and cats on the ranch..

name: water
description: fresh water, by the Monastir, parking beside

name: Viewpoint on dirt road
description: Viewpoint next to a dirt road. The view is amazing. (Picture without the view. So i don't spoil it) There is a small shelter and a fireplace. To get here is a different story. If you want to drive here its only possible from the south. It is next to a gravel road and the road is not suitable for anything bigger than a VW transporter and some ground clearance is needed....if you want to continu this road beyond this point 4x4 and ground clearance its a must. Eventually you wil be back on the road in between! the borderposts of Montenegro and bosnia.

name: big free parking area near the beach
description: parking is free, under trees it's possible, opposite the parking area are a lot of Restaurants, minimarket and a Promenade, cold showers by the beach, no 4x4 nessesary, at night quitly, a lot of campers here

name: Auto Camp Totograd
description: Nice campsite overlooking river 10m below. Tent camping €10 and cars and overlanders €15. Has private rooms, €35, which are clean and great bathroom overlooking river and a restaurant with beer. Easy to locate and friendly staff. The food was not that great.

name: Flat 'n' Leveled
description: A good place to wildcamp in Savnik. It's very close to the town, where most places are private, farmland or steep. The plateau is right next to the road, however hardly any car passed in the night and it was surprisingly quiet. We pitched our tent here since it already became dark when we arrived and nobody cared. Beautiful view over the town, but unfortunately some garbage around.

name: Auto Camp Vranjina
description:
New big Camp since August 22. Super friendly owner NICOLA. Space for a lot of vans. Enough hot showers, toilets, drinking water, energy, good WiFi. 15€/night for 2 in a van. You can stand close to the beautiful river. shadow and sun spots available. Has a Bar with cold drinks. Super quiet and safe place.
2 Restaurants nearby.

name: Restoran Kestel
description: This is a restaurant car park just off the main road outside Niksic. I just arrived and spoke with the manager and he said motor homes that left no mess were welcome to park, use Wi-Fi and use the toilets (which are closed from 11pm until 8am), so long as we eat a meal there. But it looks good with 8 locals cars in the car park. Part of menu attached

name: Parking beach
description: I slept at flat parking at night with my tent . No problem . Large flat place . I saw 3 Motorhome more . And shower in beach ( free ) and one coffee restaurant named Corso

name: Murići beach
description:
A perfect place to wild camp and swim. Maybe busier in the summer but just fisherman going past on their boats. Table and chairs available and place to have a fire. Also a covered toilet hole nearby.
Restaurant and camp site on the next beach possible to get water from.
